name: Barbell Overhead Press
description: The foundational compound shoulder exercise pressing a barbell from shoulder level to full overhead extension while standing. This movement builds overall shoulder strength and stability while engaging the entire body for support.
instructions: Grip barbell just outside shoulder width in a rack at shoulder height
Unrack bar, resting it on front deltoids with elbows forward
Brace core, squeeze glutes, take a breath and hold
Press bar straight up, moving head back slightly to clear chin
Lock out overhead with bar over mid-foot, lower with control

name: Seated Barbell Overhead Press
description: An overhead press variation performed seated on a bench to reduce lower body involvement and isolate the shoulders. The seated position provides back support while eliminating momentum from the legs.
instructions: Set bench at 90 degrees or slightly reclined in a rack
Sit with back firmly against pad, feet flat on floor
Unrack barbell at shoulder height, grip just outside shoulders
Press bar straight up, moving head back to clear
Lock out overhead, lower with control to starting position

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: A versatile overhead pressing movement using dumbbells that allows for natural arm path and independent loading of each shoulder. Can be performed seated or standing to build shoulder strength and size.
instructions: Sit on bench with back support, dumbbells at shoulder height
Hold dumbbells with palms facing forward, elbows bent at 90 degrees
Press dumbbells straight up, bringing them together at the top
Lock out with arms fully extended overhead
Lower with control back to starting position

name: Standing Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: An overhead press performed standing with dumbbells, requiring greater core stability and full-body engagement. The standing position increases the functional demand and allows for natural scapular movement.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells at shoulder height
Brace core tight, squeeze glutes for stability
Press dumbbells overhead until arms are fully extended
Bring dumbbells together at top with control
Lower slowly back to shoulder height

name: Push Press
description: An explosive overhead press that uses leg drive to initiate the movement, allowing for heavier loads than strict pressing. This power exercise builds shoulder strength while developing total body coordination and explosiveness.
instructions: Start with barbell in front rack position at shoulders
Dip slightly by bending knees 4-6 inches
Explosively drive through legs to propel bar upward
Press bar overhead to lockout as legs extend
Lower bar under control back to starting position
formCues: Legs fully extend before press finishes

name: Arnold Press
description: A dumbbell shoulder press variation made famous by Arnold Schwarzenegger that incorporates rotation through the pressing motion. The rotational component increases time under tension and engages all three deltoid heads.
instructions: Sit with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing you
Begin pressing while simultaneously rotating palms outward
Continue until arms are fully extended with palms facing forward
Reverse the motion, rotating palms back toward you as you lower
Return to start position with palms facing you

name: Z Press
description: An overhead press performed seated on the floor with legs extended, eliminating all lower body support and requiring exceptional core strength. This challenging variation builds pure pressing strength and exposes mobility limitations.
instructions: Sit on floor with legs extended straight in front
Clean or have partner hand you barbell at shoulder height
Keep torso completely upright without leaning back
Press bar overhead to full lockout
Lower with control, maintaining upright posture

name: Landmine Press
description: A pressing variation using a barbell anchored at one end in a landmine attachment, pressing at an angle that is easier on the shoulders. This movement allows for natural scapular movement and provides an alternative pressing angle.
instructions: Stand facing landmine, holding end of barbell at shoulder with both hands or one hand
Position feet shoulder-width apart in athletic stance
Press barbell up and away at roughly 45-degree angle
Extend arm(s) fully at top of movement
Lower with control back to shoulder level
formCues: Press at angle, not straight up

name: Pike Push-Up
description: A bodyweight shoulder pressing movement performed in an inverted V position that mimics the overhead press pattern. This calisthenics exercise builds shoulder strength and serves as a progression toward handstand push-ups.
instructions: Start in push-up position, then walk hands back and lift hips high
Form an inverted V with body, keeping legs and arms straight
Position head between arms, looking at feet
Bend elbows to lower head toward floor
Press back up to starting position
formCues: Keep legs as straight as possible

name: Wall-Assisted Handstand Push-Up
description: An advanced bodyweight shoulder exercise performed in a handstand against a wall, pressing the body up and down. This challenging movement builds exceptional shoulder and tricep strength while developing balance.
instructions: Kick up into handstand position facing away from wall, heels touching wall
Position hands shoulder-width apart, fingers spread
Brace core and squeeze glutes for stability
Bend elbows to lower head toward floor
Press back up to full arm extension

name: Machine Shoulder Press
description: A shoulder press performed on a guided machine that provides a fixed path of motion and enhanced safety. This beginner-friendly option allows focus on muscle contraction without balance demands.
instructions: Adjust seat so handles are at shoulder height
Sit with back firmly against pad, feet flat on floor
Grip handles with overhand grip
Press handles straight up to full arm extension
Lower with control back to starting position

name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Press
description: A unilateral overhead press performed with one dumbbell at a time, demanding increased core stability and addressing strength imbalances. The asymmetric loading challenges anti-rotation and anti-lateral flexion.
instructions: Stand or sit with one dumbbell at shoulder height
Brace core firmly against rotation
Press dumbbell overhead to full extension
Keep torso straight, don't lean to opposite side
Lower with control, complete all reps then switch arms

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
description: The fundamental isolation exercise for the side deltoids, raising dumbbells out to the sides to shoulder height. This movement builds shoulder width and the coveted 'capped' shoulder look.
instructions: Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms facing body
Keep slight bend in elbows throughout movement
Raise arms out to sides until parallel to floor
Lead with elbows, not hands
Lower with control back to starting position

name: Cable Lateral Raise
description: A lateral raise performed with a cable providing constant tension throughout the range of motion. The cable resistance curve eliminates the dead spot at the bottom of the movement.
instructions: Stand beside low cable with handle in far hand
Arm starts across body or at side
Raise arm out to side until parallel to floor
Keep slight bend in elbow throughout
Lower with control, complete all reps then switch

name: Leaning Lateral Raise
description: A lateral raise variation performed while holding a sturdy object and leaning away, increasing the range of motion and stretch on the side deltoid. The angle change intensifies the exercise at the bottom portion.
instructions: Hold a sturdy upright with one hand, dumbbell in other
Lean away from support, arm hanging straight down
Raise dumbbell out to side to shoulder height
Keep slight elbow bend and lead with elbow
Lower with control, complete all reps then switch

name: Machine Lateral Raise
description: A lateral raise performed on a machine with pads at the elbows, providing consistent resistance and eliminating balance demands. This beginner-friendly option allows focus on the side deltoid contraction.
instructions: Sit in machine with back against pad
Position elbows against arm pads at sides
Grip handles or place hands on pads
Raise arms out to sides until parallel to floor
Lower with control back to starting position

name: Y-Raise
description: A shoulder exercise raising arms diagonally to form a Y-shape, targeting the side and front deltoids along with the lower trapezius. This movement promotes shoulder health and scapular stability.
instructions: Stand or lie prone on incline bench holding light dumbbells
Start with arms hanging down or at sides
Raise arms diagonally to form a Y-shape overhead
Keep thumbs pointing up throughout movement
Lower with control back to starting position

name: Lu Raise
description: A shoulder exercise made famous by Olympic weightlifter Lu Xiaojun, combining a lateral raise with an overhead press in one fluid motion. This movement builds shoulder endurance and stability across multiple angles.
instructions: Stand with light dumbbells at sides
Perform lateral raise to shoulder height, arms parallel to floor
From there, press dumbbells overhead to lockout
Lower back to lateral raise position (arms parallel to floor)
Lower back to sides to complete one rep
commonMistakes: Skipping the pause at shoulder height

name: Band Lateral Raise
description: A lateral raise using resistance bands that provides accommodating resistance, increasing tension at the top of the movement. This accessible variation is perfect for home workouts and warm-ups.
instructions: Stand on center of resistance band, handles in each hand
Start with arms at sides, band with some tension
Raise arms out to sides until parallel to floor
Lead with elbows, keep slight elbow bend
Lower with control, maintaining band tension

name: Dumbbell Front Raise
description: An isolation exercise targeting the front deltoids by raising dumbbells in front of the body to shoulder height. This movement builds anterior shoulder development and complements pressing exercises.
instructions: Stand with dumbbells at thighs, palms facing body
Keep slight bend in elbows throughout
Raise one or both dumbbells in front to shoulder height
Keep torso stable, don't lean back
Lower with control back to starting position

name: Cable Front Raise
description: A front raise performed with a cable providing constant tension throughout the entire range of motion. The cable eliminates dead spots and allows for controlled, focused front deltoid work.
instructions: Stand facing away from low cable with handle in one or both hands
Start with arm(s) behind body or at sides
Raise arm(s) in front until parallel to floor
Keep slight elbow bend, core engaged
Lower with control back to starting position

name: Plate Front Raise
description: A front raise using a weight plate held at the edges, providing a neutral grip and engaging the forearms along with the front deltoids. The plate grip variation adds unique muscle recruitment.
instructions: Stand holding weight plate at 3 and 9 o'clock positions
Start with plate at thigh level
Raise plate in front until arms parallel to floor
Keep arms slightly bent, core tight
Lower with control back to thighs

name: Barbell Front Raise
description: A front raise using a barbell for bilateral loading of the front deltoids. The fixed bar path challenges both shoulders equally and allows for slightly heavier loading than dumbbell variations.
instructions: Stand holding barbell at thighs with overhand grip, shoulder-width
Keep slight bend in elbows throughout
Raise bar in front until parallel to floor
Keep torso upright, core engaged
Lower with control back to thighs

name: Alternating Dumbbell Front Raise
description: A front raise variation alternating one arm at a time, allowing focus on each shoulder independently while providing continuous work. This variation extends time under tension and improves mind-muscle connection.
instructions: Stand with dumbbells at thighs, palms facing body
Raise one dumbbell to shoulder height while other stays at side
Lower the raised arm with control
Raise opposite arm as first arm lowers or completes
Continue alternating for target reps

name: Reverse Pec Deck
description: A machine exercise targeting the rear deltoids by pulling handles apart in a reverse fly motion. The machine path provides consistent resistance and is excellent for isolating the posterior shoulder.
instructions: Sit facing the pec deck machine, chest against pad
Grip handles with arms extended in front
Keep slight bend in elbows throughout
Pull handles apart in arc until arms are out to sides
Squeeze rear delts at end, return with control

name: Dumbbell Reverse Fly
description: A rear deltoid isolation exercise performed bent over, lifting dumbbells out to the sides in a reverse fly motion. This movement builds posterior shoulder development and improves posture.
instructions: Bend forward at hips until torso is nearly parallel to floor
Let dumbbells hang below with palms facing each other
Raise dumbbells out to sides in arc motion
Squeeze shoulder blades together at top
Lower with control back to starting position

name: Cable Reverse Fly
description: A rear deltoid isolation using cables for constant tension throughout the movement. The cables provide resistance in both directions, maximizing time under tension for the posterior shoulder.
instructions: Stand in center of cable crossover, grab opposite handles
Start with arms crossed in front at shoulder height
Pull handles apart and back in reverse fly motion
Squeeze rear delts with arms out to sides
Return to crossed position with control

name: Face Pull
description: A cable exercise pulling the rope attachment toward the face with external rotation, targeting the rear delts and rotator cuff. This essential movement promotes shoulder health and counters the effects of pressing.
instructions: Set cable at upper chest to face height with rope attachment
Grip rope with thumbs toward you, step back to create tension
Pull rope toward face, separating hands as you pull
Finish with hands beside ears, elbows high
Squeeze rear delts and external rotators, return with control
commonMistakes: Pulling to chest instead of face

name: Prone Y-T-W Raises
description: A shoulder stability exercise performed lying face down, raising arms into Y, T, and W positions to target the rear delts, lower traps, and rotator cuff from multiple angles. Essential for shoulder health and posture.
instructions: Lie face down on floor or incline bench, arms hanging down
Y: Raise arms diagonally overhead forming Y, thumbs up
T: Raise arms straight out to sides forming T, thumbs up
W: Pull elbows back with arms bent, externally rotating at top
Perform each position for prescribed reps or as a sequence

name: Band Pull-Apart
description: A simple but effective rear deltoid and upper back exercise pulling a resistance band apart horizontally. This movement is excellent for warm-ups, posture correction, and high-rep shoulder work.
instructions: Hold band in front at shoulder height with straight arms
Grip band with hands shoulder-width apart
Pull band apart by spreading arms to sides
Squeeze shoulder blades together at full stretch
Return to start with control, maintaining tension

name: Rear Delt Row
description: A rowing variation performed with elbows high and wide to target the rear deltoids rather than the lats. This movement combines rowing mechanics with a rear delt emphasis.
instructions: Set up as for bent over row, holding dumbbells or barbell
Flare elbows out to 90 degrees from body
Row weight up leading with elbows going wide
Squeeze rear delts at top, upper arms parallel to floor
Lower with control back to start

name: Cable External Rotation
description: A rotator cuff exercise using a cable for external shoulder rotation, essential for shoulder health and injury prevention. This movement strengthens the infraspinatus and teres minor muscles.
instructions: Set cable at elbow height, stand sideways to machine
Hold handle with far hand, elbow bent 90 degrees at side
Keep elbow pinned to side throughout movement
Rotate forearm outward away from body
Control return to starting position

name: Dumbbell External Rotation
description: A rotator cuff exercise performed lying on the side, rotating a dumbbell outward against gravity. This accessible movement is fundamental for shoulder prehabilitation and rehabilitation.
instructions: Lie on side with top arm's elbow bent 90 degrees, resting on waist
Hold light dumbbell in top hand
Keep elbow pinned to waist throughout
Rotate forearm upward toward ceiling
Lower with control back to starting position

name: Cable Internal Rotation
description: A rotator cuff exercise targeting the subscapularis through internal shoulder rotation against cable resistance. This movement balances external rotation work for complete rotator cuff health.
instructions: Set cable at elbow height, stand sideways to machine
Hold handle with near hand, elbow bent 90 degrees at side
Keep elbow pinned to side throughout
Rotate forearm inward toward belly
Control return to starting position

name: Cuban Press
description: A shoulder complex combining external rotation with an overhead press in one fluid motion. This movement targets the rotator cuff, rear delts, and all pressing muscles in a single comprehensive exercise.
instructions: Stand with light dumbbells, perform upright row to elbows at shoulder height
From there, externally rotate forearms upward until parallel to floor
Press dumbbells overhead to lockout
Reverse sequence: lower to shoulder, rotate down, lower to thighs
Complete sequence counts as one rep
